mininet Package¶

CustomBootedTopo Module¶

Support for customized booting of Mininet topologies

class emulators.mininet.CustomBootedTopo.CustomBootedTopo(controller_ip, controller_port, switches, group_size, group_delay_ms, hosts_per_switch)[source]¶

Bases: object

Superclass representing a Mininet topology that is being booted in custom way. Switches are being added in groups with certain delay between each group.

add_switches(switches_to_add, startflg=True)[source]¶

Adds switches to the topology

Param :switches_to_add: number of switches to be added
Param :startflg: if True the newly added switch is started so that its

link with the rest of the switches within the topology becomes active. :type: switches_to_add: int :type: startflg: bool

get_switches()[source]¶

Returns the total number of switches of the topology

Returns:number of switches of the topology
Return type:int
init_topology()[source]¶

Inits the topology

ping_all()[source]¶

All-to-all host pinging used for testing.

remove_switches(switches_to_remove)[source]¶

Removes switches objects equal to “switches_to_remove” from the current topology. _switch_hosts, _switch_links dictionaries are also updated when a switch is removed.

Param :switches_to_remove: the number of switches to remove from the

topology :type: switches_to_remove: int

start_topology()[source]¶

Starts the topology

stop_topology()[source]¶

Stops the topology

DisconnectedTopo Module¶

Customly-booted Mininet topology (disconnected type)

Bases: emulators.mininet.CustomBootedTopo.CustomBootedTopo

Disconnected-type topology

MeshTopo Module¶

Customly-booted Mininet topology (mesh type)

Bases: emulators.mininet.CustomBootedTopo.CustomBootedTopo

Mesh-type topology

get_switches_handler Module¶

Handler for querying a Mininet REST server for the number of switches in the Mininet topology of the current node

emulators.mininet.get_switches_handler.get_switches()[source]¶

Command line arguments:

  1. IP address of the Mininet REST server
  2. Port number of the Mininet REST server

It returns on the console standard output the current number of switches of the topology

init_topology_handler Module¶

Handler for requesting a Mininet REST server to initialize a Mininet topology on the current node

emulators.mininet.init_topology_handler.init_topology_main()[source]¶

Command line arguments:

  1. IP address of the Mininet REST server
  2. Port number of the Mininet REST server
  3. IP address of the controller
  4. OF port number of the controller
  5. Mininet topology type
  6. Mininet topology size
  7. Mininet group size
  8. Mininet goup delay (in milliseconds)
  9. Mininet hosts per switch

mininet_custom_boot Module¶

With this module re start the REST Mininet server, that manages a Mininet topology

emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.add_switches(num_switches)[source]¶

Calls the add_switches() method of the current topology object to add switches to the topology.

Parameters:num_switches (int) – the number of switches to add to the topology.
emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.get_switches()[source]¶

Calls the get_switches() method of the current topology object to query the current number of switches.

Returns:number of switches of the topology
Return type:int
emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.init(ip_address, port, topo, size, group, delay, hosts)[source]¶

Initializes a new topology object. The type of the new topology is defined by the topo parameter.

Parameters:
  • ip_address – controller IP address
  • port – controller OF port number
  • topo – type of the topology we want to start (“DisconnectedTopo”,

“LinearTopo”, “MeshTopo”) :param size: initial number of switches to boot the topology with :param group: group addition size :paran delay: group addition delay (in milliseconds) :param hosts: number of hosts per switch. :type ip_address: str :type port: int :type topo: str :type size: int :type group: int :type delay: int :param hosts: int

emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.ping_all()[source]¶

Calls the ping_all() method of the current topology object to issue all-to-all ping commands

emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.remove_switches(num_switches)[source]¶

Calls the remove_switches() method of the current topology object to remove switches from the topology.

Parameters:num_switches (int) – the number of switches to remove
emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.rest_start()[source]¶

Starts Mininet REST server

emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.start()[source]¶

Calls the start_topology() method of the current topology object to start the switches of the topology.

emulators.mininet.mininet_custom_boot.stop()[source]¶

Calls the stop_topology() method of the current topology object to terminate the topology.

start_topology_handler Module¶

Handler for requesting a Mininet REST server to start a Mininet topology on the current node

emulators.mininet.start_topology_handler.mininet_start_main()[source]¶

Command line arguments:

  1. IP Address of the Mininet REST server
  2. Port number of the Mininet REST server

stop_topology_handler Module¶

emulators.mininet.stop_topology_handler.mininet_stop_main()[source]¶

Command line arguments:

  1. IP Address of the Mininet REST server
  2. Port number of the Mininet REST server
